This preprocessing method was used to enhance the spectral data and improve the accuracy of the discriminant model.

In terms of accuracy, the results showed that the discriminant model achieved high accuracy in identifying the origin and storage age of tangerine peel. The origin identification accuracy was reported to be 96.99%, indicating that the model could accurately distinguish the geographical origin of the tangerine peel. Additionally, the storage age identification accuracy was 100% for Guangdong tangerine peel and 97.15% for Sichuan tangerine peel, suggesting that the model could effectively determine the storage age of the tangerine peel.

Overall, the chosen metric, SGFD-LDA, demonstrated high accuracy in identifying the origin and storage age of tangerine peel, making it a reliable method for on-site identification using near-infrared spectroscopy combined with machine learning.

instruction: How effective was the combination of a handheld near-infrared (NIR) spectrometer and machine learning in identifying the geographical origin and storage age of tangerine peel?
Output:
The combination of a handheld near-infrared (NIR) spectrometer and machine learning was effective in identifying the geographical origin and storage age of tangerine peel. The past study used a handheld NIR spectrometer to scan the outer surface of tangerine peel and collect NIR diffuse reflectance spectra. Principal component analysis (PCA) combined with Mahalanobis distance were used to detect outliers, effectively identifying samples that deviated from the norm. After removing the outliers, PCA was performed to explore the clustering characteristics of tangerine peels from different origins and the same origin with different storage ages. The results showed that tangerine peels from the same origin or the same storage age had the potential to cluster, indicating a certain similarity in their spectral data. 

To achieve qualitative identification of origin and storage age, the past study used preprocessing techniques such as Savitzky-Golay convolution smoothing with first derivative (SGFD) and standard normal variate (SNV) on the raw spectra. Random forest (RF), K-nearest neighbor (KNN), and linear discriminant analysis (LDA) were then employed to establish the discriminant model. The results demonstrated that SGFD-LDA could accurately distinguish the origin and storage age of tangerine peel simultaneously
